name: Cherry Tomato
basicCare: Needs at least 6-8 hours of direct sun. Water regularly and deeply, especially during fruiting. Provide support (staking or cage). Fertilize every 2-3 weeks.

name: Sweet Basil
basicCare: Needs 4-6 hours of sun (can tolerate some afternoon shade). Water when top inch of soil is dry. Pinch back tips to encourage bushier growth. Prefers warm conditions.

name: Leaf Lettuce
basicCare: Prefers cooler weather; provide afternoon shade in hot climates. Keep soil consistently moist. Can be harvested leaf by leaf. Bolt-resistant varieties are good for warmer seasons.

name: Carrot (Nantes)
basicCare: Needs deep, loose soil free of stones. Water regularly to keep soil moist but not waterlogged. Thin seedlings to proper spacing. Full sun is best, but can tolerate light shade.

name: Bell Pepper (California Wonder)
basicCare: Requires long, warm growing season. Needs at least 6 hours of sun. Water consistently, especially during flowering and fruiting. May need support when laden with fruit.

name: Spinach (Bloomsdale)
basicCare: Prefers cool weather and can tolerate light frost. Full sun in cool weather, partial shade in warmer areas. Keep soil moist. Harvest outer leaves to prolong production.

name: Radish (Cherry Belle)
basicCare: Grows very quickly, often ready in a month. Prefers cool soil. Water consistently for best texture. Plant in succession for continuous harvest.
